Please find the attachment regarding shortlisted candidates of MECON for final round of interview.Instructions from MECON:Reporting Time: 09:30 AMVenue: MECON Limited,Vivekananda Path, Doranda,Ranchi 834002, Jharkhand.Contact person: Ms. Neha Chahal, Manager (HR), HR Department, MECON, RanchiContact No: 0651-248-3403 / 3571/7761827669Please note the following :1. It is requested to inform the candidates with respect to their interview schedule as no separate communication will be made to the candidates.2. No request for change in schedule and mode of interview shall be entertained. Failure to be present on the day of interview will lead to the cancelation of the candidature.3. Travelling Allowance: The candidates appearing for Personal Interview shall be reimbursed with Travelling Allowance from their home/College to Ranchi as per Company rules. Entitlement for the same shall be as follows:III Tier A/C (3A)/ CC by Rail/ Rs. 7 per Km by road or at actual, whichever is less.The same can be claimed only of submission of proof of travel documents like original ticket etc to be submitted at the time of Interview.4. Lodging & Boarding: Accommodation shall be provided to the candidates coming for the personal interview. However, in case candidate would like to arrange their own accommodations they may do so.Details of MECON arrangement are as under:B 5 Guest HouseMECON ColonyDoranda, Ranchi,Jharkhand, India.Contact Person:Guest House Caretaker: Mr. Sandeep: 6291392027Room Allotment: Ms. Shweta: 9523426383/Mr. Mukund: 6200312909For any other Assistance: Mr. Sunil Kumar Nagwanshi, Senior Manager (Administration) : 6202839866Ms. Chennavsvaya Murmu, DGM I/c (Admn.): 82103421065. All candidates must bring with them a copy of this mail (candidates are advised to check their email immediately) and original certificates along with one set of self attested copies and a soft copy of all self attested documents in support of:I. Date of birth (matriculation/ secondary board level certificate/ municipal birth certificate) in support of age.II. All academic qualification certificates and mark sheets (matriculation onwards). Last semester / year mark sheet or consolidated mark sheet in support of prescribed percentage of marks in requisite educational qualification. Final/provisional certificate for graduation and post-graduation, as applicable. In cases where CGPA is awarded, students must carry the copy of the conversion certificate or the same maybe shared by college.III. EWS certificate (if applicable) in the prescribed format for appointment to post under government of India. EWS certificate should be in prescribed format (provided on MECONs website) and valid as on the date of interview. Valid EWS certificate is mandatory for claiming reservation under EWS category.IV. Caste certificate (if applicable) in the prescribed format for appointment to the post under government of India. OBC (NCL) certificate should be in the prescribed format enclosed as attachment and valid as on the date of interview.V. Pan card.VI. Aadhar cardVII. Disability certificate (if applicable) in the prescribed format as per government guidelinesVIII. In case of mismatch in name in qualification documents vis-a- vis application form, the candidate needs to produce affidavit at the time of verification of documents.6. If the documents mentioned above are not brought at the time of verification, no additional time shall be given for arrangement of documents.7. This call letter is strictly provisional and is issued based on the information and supporting documents provided in the application. The mere fact that the call letter has been issued does not imply that the candidates candidature has been accepted by Mecon. You may please note that Mecon will take up the verification of eligibility conditions, i.e., age, educational qualifications and status (i.e. EWS/PWD etc.) With reference to original documents only at the time of interview of candidates. Please note that if at any stage, it is found that the candidate do not satisfy the eligibility criteria as given, or the information furnished by the candidate in the application is incorrect, the candidature is liable to be cancelled forthwith, with such further action as Mecon would like to take. Hence, it is advised to ensure all the documents are correct and produced, before proceeding to appear for the interview.8. In the event, the candidate are found not fulfilling the eligibility criteria or do not produce complete documents, they shall not be allowed to appear for the interview under any circumstances9. The interview process may spread for the whole day and can also spill over to the next day, therefore, all candidates may come prepared accordingly. Chairman CDC

Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering (Dual Degree and M.Tech)Further details: (Internship cum Placement offer subject to PPO conversion)2024 graduating students will pursue a 3-month internship starting from May, 2024. Abroad for higher studies related Workshop

In the recent times you might have heard the news about Indian students facing problems during their stay in abroad for higher studies.The most common issues are * Countries sending students back * Visa processing issues / Visa rejections * Lack of part-time job opportunities * Confusion in choosing the country/university for better future.Understanding the need of the students, a free online workshop to bring awareness among the students who aspires to study abroad but lacks the basic information and guidance.Students willing to participate in this online workshop must register themselves. Registration to this workshop is free of cost.https://forms.gle/jAi1R1qqRrEgLjVE8Chairman,CDC

Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL), Indias premier public sector enterprise feels immense pleasurer to build active collaboration between academia and Industry, towards realizing the vision of 'AtmaNirbhar Bharat'.BHE has been playing a pivotal role in shaping the engineering and manufacturing capability in India across several core sectors, including power generation and transmission, transportation, renewables, water, oil & gas and defence & aerospace.Collaborating with academia, BHEL has recently developed a Technology Innovation Platform 'SANRACHNA', under the aegis of the Ministry of Heavy Industries, Govt. of India, which serves to be a digitally enabled multi-domain collaborative platform with the aim to be a one-stop solution to bring together and enable Start-ups, Entrepreneurs, Industries, Institutes, Students and Researchers, who aspire to create solutions that can transform India.This would require the spirit of Entrepreneurship & Innovation to be ignited in the minds of young students at a very early stage. With this vision, BHEL is organizing a 4-day Online Training programme 'KAUSHAL 3.0: Technology Horizons' for young engineering students, especially first/second year students, offering them an early opportunity to learn from the industry experts and develop an industrial perspective.A detailed information flyer is attached with this for your perusal. The process for registration and other important instructions/guidelines are detailed in the flyer. Alternatively, you may visit 'SanRachna' portal https://sanrachna.bhel.in/ for further details. Note: To make it convenient for the students, BEHL has planned only 90 minute session each day in the afternoon. All sessions shall be conducted through video conferencing.The VC link shall be shared directly with the applicants, post their registration. Registration starts on 7th March 2024 and closes on 14th March 2024.Training Programme (4 days) 18th March 2024 to 21st March 2024Chairman CDC

HARD COPY CV SUBMISSION ALONG WITH APPLICATION FORM TO BE SUBMITTED AT CDC OFFICE WITHIN DEADLINE.NO ERP APPLICATION IS REQUIRED FOR THE TIME BEING.ELIGIBLE DEPARTMENT:UG and PG students:Geotechnical EngineeringComputer ScienceConstruction Management/ Civil EngineeringThe students pursuing Undergraduate/Post Graduate/Post Graduate Diploma Courses shall have a good academic record and with minimum 75% Marks or Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of 7.5 out of 10 as on the last semester, whose result has been declared.THOSE WHO HAVE GOT CDC INTERNSHIP ARE ADVISED NOT TO APPLYStudents are advised to find below the internship application process for the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) form, which involves filling Google form and submitting all the three forms in hard copy format to the CDC office with proper signatures by thedeadline of 4 PM on 31st January 2024 Form Link:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/12OVylIaRsLnDY5xeb_yl9fhM7DLdgaL11_BTyJqz1c0/editApplication Process:Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is the National Standards Body of India, established under an Act of Parliament, the BIS Act, 2016. It is engaged in the activities of Standardization at national & international levels and operating Conformity Assessment Schemes such as the Product Certification Scheme (popularly known as the ISI Marking Scheme), Hallmarking of Gold & Silver articles and Management System Certification etc. All these activities are aimed at creating a vibrant quality ecosystem in the country to ensure the availability of quality goods & services to the consumers through the industries implementing the quality standards.2. BIS intends to engage students as interns for conducting Pre-Standardization study under the technical deptts. of BIS at Delhi. The internship programme includes the following:a. Orientation programme at National Institute of training for standardization (NITS), Noida the training wing of BIS.b. Finalization of the topic of study in consultation with HoD and Member secretary of the technical deptt.c. Examination of existing technical literature, survey, including journals, articles, research reports, and related national / international reports if any.d. Horizon scanning of the entire quality ecosystem for identification of key stakeholders like leading manufacturers (both large and small scale covering the entire spectrum of industry), organized users and target groups, testing laboratories, R& D institutions etc.e. Interaction with stakeholders including visit to manufacturers / labs and stakeholders meetings.f. Analysis of manufacturing processes from sustainability angle.g. Pre-submission consultation with technical deptt and member secretary.h. Preparation of draft specification.3. The interns will be paid a monthly stipend of Rs. 20,000/-.4. The students will be benefited from this exercise in terms of not only getting a sound understanding of the importance and status of standards and quality consciousness in diverse sectors of Indian economy but also gain an insight into the process of standardization, implementation of standards and the role of India in International standardization. This will, in addition, help them to hone their skills for empirical study and research- related work.5.As for the Structure of the Internship Programme, it will be mandatory for the interns to work for a week ( 7 working days) , under the direct supervision of the Standardization Department concerned. The concerned department may allow the interns to work from home thereafter. However, the intern shall be in constant touch with the Standardization Department and must attend VCs or webinars organized by BIS to discuss their work. Draft report should be submitted positively by 7th week of the assignment and the final report, by the 8th week, incorporating the suggestions and comments on the draft report, and subsequent presentation will follow thereafter until the end of internship."Institute approved internship window is : 29.04.2024 to 19.07.2024.Company will choose 8 weeks from this window.6.CG Criteria 7.5 and above as on the last semester, whose result has been declared.7. Fill the forms: as per the Following Annexures and Proformas (enclosed herein). The proformas have to be filled and signed by the Student/ as mentioned:a) Application proforma (As per Annex II)b) Acceptance of Terms and Conditions of Internship (Appendix A of Annex II) - to be signed by the studentc) Undertaking by the Institute/University (Page 2 of Annex II) - TO BE SIGNED BY THE DEPTDeadline: The duly filled proforma have to be filled to the CDC office by 4 PM on 31st January 2024 ATTACH ONE COPY OF YOUR ERP CV WITH FILLED AND DULY SIGNED APPLICATION.FILL THE GOOGLE FORM as mentioned above.Chairman CDC

Dear students, as the Placement Drive is right around the corner, below are a few points that should be kept in mind and followed on the day of the process:1. All communication will be done through WhatsApp groups so it is your responsibility to stay active and be prompt to follow the instructions sent there. The students who joined the WhatsApp groups via contact numbers different from their ERP contact numbers must reach out to the respective POC with their name and roll number.2. In case you have any queries regarding the process you may reach out to the respective PoC as mentioned in the Intraday on the notice board.3. Students are required to report to their respective venue 30 minutes before the scheduled time in formal attire.4. Keep checking ERP Notice Board because in case of an urgency/urgent information, students would be expected to report to Nalanda immediately.5. Students must stay in their allocated waiting room. No student should be seen roaming around in the premises of Nalanda.6. There are food stalls arranged for students at Nalanda. They may help themselves to it.7. Students sitting for interview processes are advised to keep atleast 10 printouts of their CVs handy.8. Students sitting for an online process are advised to bring their laptop, charger, earphones and any other required device to the venue. It is the sole responsibility of the student to ensure that their system is working.Chairman, CDC

CDC is trying its best to create necessary arrangements to conduct our Placement process 2023-24.By this notice, CDC wishes to remind all students to follow the CDC rules strictly without any deviation.The participating students are advised to give special attention to the following:1. This year all the interviews (online and on campus interviews) will be conducted at Nalanda complex. Students are advised to attend the interviews and other related process from Nalanda only.2. Keep your pen, pad, copy of your CV (sufficient copies) , all electronic gadgets (laptop, charger, power bank, earphone etc.) handy.3. Keep one Govt ID card, Institute ID card handy.4. Dress code is formal.5. As the process is being conducted in hybrid mode, your process may be preponed or postponed. Hence be available in whatsapp and mobile. CDC office/ Placecom member may call you at any time. Keep checking CDC notice board on regular intervals.6. No student participant should directly deal with any campus company for any offer, and it is not supported by CDC.7. Students are strictly advised not to discuss slot or any other interview details of any particular company to any third party or other companies at any stage of the process or during the interview also , to avoid controversy. 8. Any queries, it should be written to CDC only from the ERP registered email ID.9. Once your interview is over you are advised to leave Nalanda complex immediately.10. Students are strictly advised not to post any information in social media/ other channel of communication to avoid any controversy.11. Students should keep sufficient printed copies of their CVs. CDC office will not provide any provision for this.Wish you all the best!!Chairman CDC

Placement registered students may take a note the followings:a) CDC will take the ERP offer acceptance. All the students must accept the offer in ERP only.b) In case of multiple offers to a single student, in ERP student should accept one offer and reject the other offer. Apart from that - for these students (multiple offer students) a Google Form will be circulated by CDC office and they should enter the same details in that formc) Student having single offer must accept the offer in ERP, no google form fill up is required. It will be considered as deemed accepted.d) As it a very time bound process offered students of a particular day is advised to be vigilant and prompt in giving the ERP acceptance.Chairman CDC

HARD COPY CV SUBMISSION ALONG WITH APPLICATION FORM TO BE SUBMITTED AT CDC OFFICE WITHIN DEADLINE.NO ERP APPLICATION IS REQUIRED FOR THE TIME BEING.THOSE WHO HAVE GOT CDC INTERNSHIP ARE ADVISED NOT TO APPLYStudents are advised to find below the internship application process for the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) form, which involves filling Google form and submitting all the three forms in hard copy format to the CDC office with proper signatures by thedeadline of 5 PM on 13th November 2023.Form Link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/12OVylIaRsLnDY5xeb_yl9fhM7DLdgaL11_BTyJqz1c0/editApplication Process:Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is the National Standards Body of India, established under an Act of Parliament, the BIS Act, 2016. It is engaged in the activities of Standardization at national & international levels and operating Conformity Assessment Schemes such as the Product Certification Scheme (popularly known as the ISI Marking Scheme), Hallmarking of Gold & Silver articles and Management System Certification etc. All these activities are aimed at creating a vibrant quality ecosystem in the country to ensure the availability of quality goods & services to the consumers through the industries implementing the quality standards. 2. BIS intends to engage students as interns for conducting Pre-Standardization study under the technical deptts. of BIS at Delhi. The internship programme includes the following: a. Orientation programme at National Institute of training for standardization (NITS), Noida the training wing of BIS.b. Finalization of the topic of study in consultation with HoD and Member secretary of the technical deptt.c. Examination of existing technical literature, survey, including journals, articles, research reports, and related national / international reports if any.d. Horizon scanning of the entire quality ecosystem for identification of key stakeholders like leading manufacturers (both large and small scale covering the entire spectrum of industry), organized users and target groups, testing laboratories, R& D institutions etc.e. Interaction with stakeholders including visit to manufacturers / labs and stakeholders meetings.f. Analysis of manufacturing processes from sustainability angle.g. Pre-submission consultation with technical deptt and member secretary.h. Preparation of draft specification. 3. The interns will be paid a monthly stipend of Rs. 20,000/-. 4. The students will be benefited from this exercise in terms of not only getting a sound understanding of the importance and status of standards and quality consciousness in diverse sectors of Indian economy but also gain an insight into the process of standardization, implementation of standards and the role of India in International standardization. This will, in addition, help them to hone their skills for empirical study and research- related work. 5.As for the Structure of the Internship Programme, it will be mandatory for the interns to work for a week ( 7 working days) , under the direct supervision of the Standardization Department concerned. The concerned department may allow the interns to work from home thereafter. However, the intern shall be in constant touch with the Standardization Department and must attend VCs or webinars organized by BIS to discuss their work. Draft report should be submitted positively by 7th week of the assignment and the final report, by the 8th week, incorporating the suggestions and comments on the draft report, and subsequent presentation will follow thereafter until the end of internship."Institute approved internship window is : 29.04.2024 to 19.07.2024.Company will choose 8 weeks from this window.6.CG Criteria 7.5 and above as on the last semester, whose result has been declared.7. Fill the forms: as per the Following Annexures and Proformas (enclosed herein). The proformas have to be filled and signed by the Student/ as mentioned:a) Application proforma (As per Annex II) b) Acceptance of Terms and Conditions of Internship (Appendix A of Annex II) - to be signed by the studentc) Undertaking by the Institute/University (Page 2 of Annex II) - TO BE SIGNED BY THE DEPTDeadline: The duly filled proforma have to be filled to the CDC office by 5 PM 13-11-23.ATTACH ONE COPY OF YOUR ERP CV WITH FILLED AND DULY SIGNED APPLICATION.FILL THE GOOGLE FORM as mentioned above.Chairman CDC

All students eligible for placements are requested to make a note of the following guidelines while appearing for the placement test- 1. Students have to appear for all the tests from Nalanda Complex. Carry your Laptop and Laptop chargers for the same. Make sure your laptop is fully charged.2. Students will not be allowed to enter the examination hall without their ID Cards. 3. Sitting pattern and room allocation for each student will be circulated prior to any test. Violating the sitting arrangement will lead to strict actions against the candidate.4. Please make sure that your attendance is marked while you are appearing for the test.5. Students should not carry Smartphones/tablets or any other gadgets inside the examination hall other than the one required to appear in the test.6. Students should not carry calculators unless specified otherwise for any test.7. Make sure you arrive at the test venue 15 minutes prior to the test time and get yourself acquainted.8. In case of any technical queries faced during the test, you may contact the invigilator present in the room.9. Make sure that you follow all the test instructions given prior to the commencement of the test by invigilators. 10. CDC will not be providing you with any rough sheets. Please carry A4 size sheets if required by you for rough work. Any kind of notebooks will not be allowed, make sure that you have A4 size sheets. 11. Attendance sheet for every test will be sent to the companies, absentees will be automatically disqualified, their test will not be evaluated and strict action will be taken (may lead to DEBARRING from further CDC process) if anyone marked absent is found participating in the test without prior permission.Keep following the official CDC noticeboard to get updates on placement activities.Chairman CDC

Offline presence at the venue specified is mandatory.3. Students are advised to make note that the CDC process may take place during the Autumn Break [between 21st October and 28th October 2023]. It is advised not to plan any travel during this break, for further information keep following the notice board.4. All the students are expected to carry their laptops and other accessories as and when needed during any test or interview. 5. All interviews will be conducted and coordinated from Nalanda complex hence presence of students at Nalanda complex is required.6. All students eligible for CDC Placements 2023-24 must fill this form (Deadline: 30th September 11:59 PM). CDC will use this data for all future processes. [Link:https://forms.gle/8dMTYaPuFNsqwLR5A]7. Follow the CDC notice board in ERP to get regular updates.8. CDC notice board in ERP is the only official means of communication for CDC related information and can be accessed through: ERP-->CDC--->Student--->application for placement/internship--->NOTICE (left corner)Chairman CDC

Students who are registering with CDC for placement facility may note the followings:CDC does not require any documentary evidence against your academic achievements such as class 10th, 12fth, Graduation , Post Graduation marks / CGPA, year of passing etc.CDC does not require any proof of your term projects, academic projects which are the part of your academics/ curricula.Self project is to to validated by any Faculty of the concerned dept/ and/or any faculty of the Institute. The document should be signed and duly stamped.For internship- Internship certificate is required OR Offer of internship letter along with an email from concerned company (mail from company domain) mentioning the work done by the student (internship topic), and duration. The mail should contain the contact number of the concerned person.Students who are mentioning their ranks in different competitions, exams, mentioning number of participants / applicants etc. are advised to keep the relevant documents handy for verification.Chairman CDC

CDC has started the registration for CDC placement 2023-24.Students are advised to prepare their CV within deadline along with the relevant documents which are needed to be uploaded for further verification.Students are advised to note the followings:a) For hall related activities concerned Warden / Asst. Warden may be approached.b) For Gymkhana related activities including inter IIT- General Secretary of Gymkhana may be approached.c) For activities of various societies- Concerned Head of the Society may be approached.d) For any activities from outside the institute, including competitions, best paper and conference etc.- mail copy of CONFIRMED PARTICIPATION and congratulatory mail for wining best papers / any prizes, E-certificate is to be uploaded.e) Project done under In house Faculty (other than academic requirement) - relevant certificate from the Faculty is to be uploaded.f) Publication: First page of publication/ acceptance of review email/ acceptance letter.g) Departmental activities/ Student council activities- Relevant proof from concerned Head/ Faculty is to be uploadedh) All PORs should be certified properly with the supporting documentsi) Any rank mentioned like code challenge rank etc.- is to supported by mail from the company domain/ certificate.j) Any scholarship - is to be supported with proper authenticate documents.k) Department rank (if mentioned)- is to be attached with supporting documents from HoD/HoS/HoCl) For M.Tech students- B.Tech projects done elsewhere - proper certificate is to be attachedm) The size of the PDF must be less than 300 KB to be uploaded in ERP.Chairman CDC

All Potential students for placement are hereby informed that CDC registration for placement (for session 2023-24) has started.Students have to complete their placement registration process (CV building) within 25th August 2023 (11.59 pm). No further extension will be provided.i) All the potential eligible students will be provided two consecutive registration windows i.e. one in the month of August (for first phase till December) and another in the month of January (for second phase till March) or one in the month of January and other in August, next year.By registering in the month of August they can participate in Phase I placement session i.e in December and by registering in the month of January they can participate in Phase-II placement i.e. from January to March.It is the choice of the students on which phase (Phase-I in December and phase-II from January to March) they want to register.However, once a student is graduated from the Institute he/she will not be permitted to participate in any further placement process, even though he/ she has not availed two opportunities or availed but not placed.ii) All the students who have accepted the PPO are strictly advised to register for CDC placement, otherwise in CDC placement data their name will be missed out..Chairman, CDC

All the MS and PhD students who are willing to register for placement session 2023-24 are advised to follow the followings.a) They should write an application (hardcopy) addressed to Chairman CDC that he / she will submit the synopsis latest by 31st January 2024, and once the defense is done he/she will be out of the placement process. It is the responsibility of the student to inform CDC about this event.b) They should also declare that they have not registered with CDC in the session 2022-23.c) This aforesaid application should be approved by the supervisor before sending it to CDC.d) CDC after verifying the same can give access to the student for 3/ 4 days and within that time period the student has to prepare his/her CV in ERP (CDC tab)e) Hence all the students (PhD/MS) applying for placement registration at CDC, is advised to check their email IDs at regular intervals.f) Once the registration process is complete, the students can see what companies (In CDC Notice Board, ERP -CDC Tab) are coming and they can apply in those companies only which are open for their dept and degree.Chairman CDC

Students are advised to keep their CV content ready along with the relevant documents which are needed to be uploaded for further verification.Students are advised to note the followings:a)For hall related activities concerned Warden / Asst. Warden may be approached.b) For Gymkhana related activities including inter IIT- General Secretary of Gymkhana may be approached.c) For activities of various societies- Concerned Head of the Society may be approached.d) For any activities from outside the institute, including competitions, best paper and conference etc.- mail copy of CONFIRMED PARTICIPATION and congratulatory mail for wining best papers / any prizes, E-certificate is to be uploaded.e) Project done under In house Faculty (other than academic requirement) - relevant certificate from the Faculty is to be uploaded.f) Publication: First page of publication/ acceptance of review email/ acceptance letter.g) Departmental activities/ Student council activities- Relevant proof from concerned Head/ Faculty is to be uploadedh) All PORs should be certified properly with the supporting documentsi) Any rank mentioned like code challenge rank etc.- is to supported by mail from the company domain/ certificate.j) Any scholarship - is to be supported with proper authenticate documents.k) Department rank (if mentioned)- is to be attached with supporting documents from HoD/HoS/HoCl) For M.Tech students- B.Tech projects done elsewhere - proper certificate is to be attached m) The size of the PDF must be less than 300 KB to be uploaded in ERP.Chairman CDC

Internship students may note the followings regarding Online tests:1. Students will bring their own Laptop and Laptop chargers for the test. Bring fully charged laptop. For online tests camera should be there in your laptop, as all the tests are proctored remotely.2. Students will not be allowed to enter the examination hall without their ID Cards. All students must bring valid Institute Identity proof for giving various tests (Student Identity card or Medical book). Without any valid Institute Identity proof students will not be allowed to take the test. No mobile screen shot of ERP will be allowed. However you can show your own ERP (live) as an identity proof and be allowed.3. Room allocation for each student is to be followed as per CDC notice.4. Please make sure that attendance is marked by you. Otherwise it will be marked ABSENT.5. Students are not to carry Smartphones/tablets or any other gadgets inside the examination hall. They may keep their bags in podium/ outside the room.6. Students are instructed not use calculators unless specified for any test. In the starting of the exam confirm it.7. CDC will not provide any rough sheets during the exams. Students are required to bring their SEPARATE rough sheets (A4 size) as per their requirement. But NOTEBOOK/ EXERCISE COPY is not allowed during the exams.8. Students are not allowed to leave the exam within first 20 mins from the starting of the exam.9. You are advised to report at the venue at least 10 min prior to the scheduled exam.Chairman CDC

The students attending CDC internship tests/ process are advised to give special attention to the following:- It is advised not to share any CDC information or information of internal notice or company data in social media or any other group or to the outsider by any means.- CDC suggests not attempting any malpractice during company tests or pre-processing, as it will invite serious punishments as per CDC rules.Any violation of the process (directly or indirectly) during the CDC hiring activities will be treated seriously for CDC level punishments. Also it will be reported to the institute authorities.The above CDC rules mainly intended to preserve the Brand-Name of our Institute and to create a "Trust-Worthy Set Up"in front of the participating Corporate Leaders to create a better hiring platform for our students.Finally, CDC also advises to all the students to cooperate, help and assist CDC to make our standards high for a bright career future.Chairman, CDC

After completion of the internship in Summer 2023 every student can fill their internship details in ERP.Find the details about this newly added functionality: 1. All students who are registered for Internship in current section can update Internship form from the menu CDC -->Student -->Upload internship feedback form. If a student has not registered in CDC the it will give below message: You did not register in CDC. You need to register in CDC. After that you can update Internship feedback form 2. If a student already selected in an internship through CDC programme then the student needs to update only Internship feedback form. It will show the below message to the student. You have already selected in an internship though CDC programme. You need to upload only Internship feedback file 3. If a student does not select in an internship through CDC programme then the student needs to update an internship form (as mentioned in step #4) and also need to upload internship feedback form. It will show the below message to the student. You have not selected in an internship though CDC programme. Provide the details in Internship formStudent can download the Internship completion Feedback Form from the below mentioned linkhttp://www.cdc.iitkgp.ac.in/ckfinder/userfiles/files/Internship%20completion%20Form(1).pdfChairman,CDC

Company name: RubrikOnline coding test will be conducted on the 18th of July (Tuesday) from 6:30pm to 8:00pmEligibility Criteria for test CGPA>8Things to be followed during the online test.The test will start exactly at 6:30 PM and no later.The test will take place between 6:30 PM and 8:00 PM, post which the link will expireStudents will be able to log in between 6:30 PM and 6:45 PM, the link will not allow you to start at or post 6:46 PMNo any extra time will be provided for anyone who starts the test post the "Start Time"For example: If you log in at 6:40 PM, your test will complete by 8:00 PM itselfThe link will work on Google Chrome browser, please ensure to have it installedTest will need to be taken in full-screen mode only, exiting the full screen will lead to disqualificationPlatform used: HackerankWebcam needs to be turned on at all times during the testNote: In case of any disqualification caused by accident it will be considered a disqualification.Example: Exiting the full-screen mode.Any disqualification that takes place will not be re-considered unless it is a platform issue or a technical glitch from our end. Please have these pointers shared with the students eligible to take the online test beforehand and ensure they are aware of the same.The test link will be shared 15 minutes prior to the shortlisted students.
